== Main Inclusion Report for racc ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/r/racc]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** parser generator for Ruby
** Build dependency of libgettext-ruby (pending MIR)
0. ''Security:''
** No known CVE entries
** No known Secunia history
** No rooted binaries or daemons
** No network activity whatsoever
** Does not directly (not through a library) process binary (video, audio, etc) or structured (PDF, etc) data
** No known source code reviews available
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Should always work out of the box
** No debconf questions asked
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:racc|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/r/racc.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is calm
** <nowiki>[[http://i.loveruby.net/en/projects/racc//|Upstream]]</nowiki> is calm
** Does not deal with hardware
** Upstream test suite available, run at build time
0. ''Standards compliance:''
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliance
** Packaging system debhelper
0. ''Dependencies:''
** libracc-runtime-ruby1.8, ruby1.8
** libracc-runtime-ruby - provided by libruby1.8
0. ''Maintenance:''
** Largely takes care of itself (or rather Debian does)
** The debian maintainer is watching over the quality of this package
0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package is clear from the package's debian/control file
** Upstream calls this software also racc
0. ''Internationalization:''
** non-graphical app
